DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to obtain a better understanding of how stress is related to health risks.
DOC.brief_title: Study of Physical Health for Women With Posttraumatic Stress or Depression
DOC.detailed_description: Participants complete up to two study visits of approximately 3-4 hours each. The first study visit involves an interview about life experiences and emotions. If the participant is eligible for the second assessment, the average length of time between visit 1 and visit 2 will be 1-7 days. The second visit included physical measurements such as cholesterol and blood pressure, performing math and speaking tasks, and surveys to help us learn about healthy behaviors and emotions. No further follow-up of participants is conducted beyond the two study visits.
DOC.criteria: Premenopausal Must be able to speak and read English fluently Specific medications and chronic diseases History of heart attack (myocardial infarction) Pregnant or given birth in last 3 months Perimenopausal or postmenopausal
